p: In the ED, the patient was alert and oriented. He had a fever of 101.8 F, blood pressure of 122/63 mmHg, heart rate of 98 beats per minute, respiratory rate of 20 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation of 97% on room air. The physical exam was unremarkable. He had no complaints of neck rigidity nor any confusion suggestive of meningitis or encephalitis. His blood work and imaging including CBC, CMP, hepatitis panel, and blood parasite smear were unremarkable. He had a mild lactic acidosis of 2.3 mmol/L. A chest X-ray was also unremarkable for any significant disease. He was admitted to the hospital with the diagnosis of sepsis and was administered broad-spectrum antibiotics.
